subject: CS
title: Introduction to Computational Mathematics
description: A rigorous introduction to the field of computational mathematics. The focus is on the interplay between continuous  models and  their solution via discrete processes. Topics include pitfalls in computation, solution of linear systems, interpolation, discrete Fourier transforms, and numerical integration. Applications are used as motivation. [Note: This course may be substituted for CS 370 in any degree plan or for prerequisite purposes; lab is not scheduled and students are expected to find time in open hours to complete their work. Offered: W,S]
